reviewText:
This is wonderful.  I bought it because I'm a female veteran of the Army.
Very interesting history of women in the Military.
great video

Saw this movie at a DAR meeting and, especially as I spent 13 years in the USAF and had a grandmother who was an Army nurse during WWI, serving in France, just had to buy a copy. A very well made film, especially topical at the moment due to the recent decision (still being contested) that late members of the WASP are no longer allowed to be buried at Arlington Cemetery, despite the fact there is a section of that cemetery RESERVED for WASPS... And the fact that, despite the increasing number of women veterans, the VA has yet to make a real effort to hire more GYN doctors... I had always known we've had women serving in just about every conflict this country has been involved in, but this documentary brings out a lot of information I wasn't aware of. It also does a really great job covering the political and legal wrangles involved as women worked to be acknowledged as warriors capable of fighting as needed. Kudos to those involved in making this documentary a reality.
Very good!
Good historical perspective of courageous women.
I saw it on netflix loved it so much I had to purchase it.

I was expecting a documentary style film - like some behind the scenes information about female veterans and the role of women in battle through history.  This starts out as the kind of video you might see while touring a "women in history" exhibit touting the successes of women in the military in small bytes with little substance.  It touches a little bit on PTSD and rape but seems to minimize this in my opinion and goes right back to what appears to be a recruiting video.  It is valuable content, but fairly superficial.
Excellent information about the many female contributions to our military. Thank you for making this recording.
Great documentary about women serving or having served this country with little recognition. Maybe like me, you'll finally feel some recognition for a woman family member that has done their duty.

A masterful,powerful look at the vital role women have played in America. Far beyond Rosie the Riveter,these remarkable,courageous, competent women gave so much,so unselfishly. This film should be included in every middle school ciriculum. Long overdue,these heroes need recognition, admiration & admiration right up there with their brothers in arms.
Wonderful.
Great documentary and tribute

Very touching and impressive. It's a damn shame that these courageous women that served during WW2 did not get the recognition, honor and credit for their brave service by those in high places. Only after many years did those still living get it.
Perfect gift for woman veterans, older or current because It's our history.
This interesting documentary fills in a lot of missing pieces in the military history of our country.  I highly recommend it for high school history classes as well as for military history buffs.
Awesome movie!  Proud to get this movie!
I completely enjoyed this DVD so I purchased it so that I could look at it again and again.
Great story. Never knew that women played such a big pary
great learning tool
with interviews, pictures, and actual footage this tells the stories of women who served in the American military. At times emotional. Insightful.
I am a female Veteran and this is a wonderful history of Women's role in the Military.

I have watched this video and I recommend it to all the women.  It's has
been properly named.
